---
layout: post
title: 3D Pixel Art
author: [cexbrayat]
tags: [ninjasquad, 3d, pixel, art]
---

As I love all the shiny new things, I wanted to try the [voxel.js](http://voxeljs.com/) project, an open source game building toolkit by [@maxogden](https://twitter.com/maxogden). But, as I'm not a game designer, I settled to build our mascot Chuck using [voxelbuilder](http://voxelbuilder.com), an online application where you use pixel blocs to build awesome pixel art. So here is what [Chuck looks like](http://voxelbuilder.com/#:C/2ecc713498db34495ee67e22ecf0f1000000)!

![3D pixel art](http://i.imgur.com/N0bZBDf.png)

Another cool thing you can do is export the voxelbuilder models in STL file format (for Stereolithography, check the [wikipedia article](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/STL_%28file_format%29) for more details) using a node.js library : [ndarray-stl](https://github.com/maxogden/ndarray-stl).

The STL file format is supported by many 3D tools and... [Github](https://help.github.com/articles/3d-file-viewer)! The awesome thing is that you can embed the models anywhere using :

    <script src="https://embed.github.com/view/3d/<username>/<repo>/<ref>/<path_to_file>"></script>

You can see below how Chuck looks in a smoothed STL format. We're now looking for a 3D printer to give a shot at printing him!

{% raw %}
<script src="https://embed.github.com/view/3d/ninja-squad/3d-pixel-art/master/ninja-squad-3d-smoothed.stl"> yay 3d!</script>
{% endraw %}
